    • Constructor Detail

      • AmountParserSettings

        public AmountParserSettings()

    • Method Detail

      • setAllowMissingDecimals

        public void setAllowMissingDecimals(boolean allowMissingDecimals)
        Sets whether amounts without decimal are accepted as valid amount, for example 1.465 is accepted as valid amount. Setting this to true can yield to more false positives because any set of consequent digits can represent valid amount.
        Parameters:
        allowMissingDecimals - whether or not amounts without decimals are allowed.

      • areMissingDecimalsAllowed

        public boolean areMissingDecimalsAllowed()
        Returns true if amounts without decimal are accepted as valid.
        Returns:
        true if amounts without decimal are accepted as valid.

      • setAllowNegativeAmounts

        public void setAllowNegativeAmounts(boolean allowNegativeAmounts)
        Sets whether negative values are accepted as valid amounts, for example -27,56 is valid amount. Setting this to true can yield to more false positives.
        Parameters:
        allowNegativeAmounts - whether or not amount can have negative value.

      • areNegativeAmountsAllowed

        public boolean areNegativeAmountsAllowed()
        Returns true if negative values are accepted as valid amount.
        Returns:
        true if negative values are accepted as valid amount.

      • setExpectCurrencyPrefix

        public void setExpectCurrencyPrefix(boolean expectCurrencyPrefix)
        Sets whether currency symbol $ is expected to be found before actual amount. When it is set to true $11.37 is more preferred than 11.37.
        Parameters:
        expectCurrencyPrefix - whether or not to expect currency symbol

      • isCurrencyPrefixExpected

        public boolean isCurrencyPrefixExpected()
        Returns true if currency symbol $ is expected to be found before actual amount.
        Returns:
        true if currency symbol $ is expected to be found before actual amount.

      • setExpectAsterixOrEqualsPrefix

        public void setExpectAsterixOrEqualsPrefix(boolean expectAsterixOrEqualsPrefix)
        Sets wether * or = is expected to be found before actual amount. When it is set to true ==11.37 is more preferred than 11.37.
        Parameters:
        expectAsterixOrEqualsPrefix - whether or not to expect asterix or equals prefix

      • isAsterixOrEqualsPrefixExpected

        public boolean isAsterixOrEqualsPrefixExpected()

      • writeToParcel

        public void writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel dest,
                          int flags)
        Specified by:
        writeToParcel in interface android.os.Parcelable
